description: Internal HR Assistant for HENRI employees. Provides information about policies, benefits, time off, onboarding, and general HR questions.
importantPolicies: All information shared with HR bot is confidential
For urgent matters, contact HR directly at hr@henri.internal
PTO requests must be submitted through the HR portal
Annual leave: 25 days paid per year
Three-month probation period for new employees
Remote work: Up to 3 days per week with manager approval

faq.question: How do I request time off?
faq.answer: Submit PTO requests through the HR portal. Employees are entitled to 25 days of paid annual leave per year in accordance with Danish holiday legislation. Requests should be submitted in advance and approved by your manager.

faq.question: What are Danish public holidays?
faq.answer: Danish Public Holidays observed: New Year's Day (1 January), Maundy Thursday (Thursday before Easter), Good Friday (Friday before Easter), Easter Monday (Monday after Easter), Great Prayer Day (4th Friday after Easter), Ascension Day (40 days after Easter), Whit Monday (50 days after Easter), Constitution Day (5 June, half day), Christmas Day (25 December), and Second Day of Christmas (26 December). Note: Most holidays are movable and depend on Easter dates.

faq.question: What are the standard working hours?
faq.answer: Standard working hours are 37 hours per week, Monday to Friday. Core working hours are from 09:00 to 15:00. Flexible scheduling may be agreed upon with a manager based on role requirements.

faq.question: What is the remote work policy?
faq.answer: Employees may work remotely up to three days per week, subject to manager approval and business needs. Employees working remotely must remain reachable during core hours, maintain productivity standards, and protect company data and systems.

faq.question: What is the probation period?
faq.answer: All new employees are subject to a three-month probation period. During this time, either party may terminate employment with shorter notice.

faq.question: How do I report sick leave?
faq.answer: Employees must notify their manager before the start of the workday. Medical documentation may be required for extended absences.

faq.question: How are salaries paid?
faq.answer: Salaries are paid monthly in arrears and deposited directly into the employee's designated Danish bank account. Salary reviews are conducted annually based on performance and company results.

faq.question: What is covered in onboarding?
faq.answer: New employees participate in a structured onboarding program that includes: system access setup, review of company policies, role-specific training, and introduction to team members.

faq.question: What happens during offboarding?
faq.answer: Upon termination of employment, employees must: return all company equipment, transfer knowledge where applicable, and complete an exit process coordinated by HR.

faq.question: What are the data protection requirements?
faq.answer: Employees must protect login credentials, comply with GDPR requirements, report any suspected data breaches immediately, and avoid using unauthorized software or devices. Company IT systems are provided for business use only.

faq.question: How do I report harassment or discrimination?
faq.answer: Harassment, discrimination, bullying, or inappropriate behavior of any kind will not be tolerated. Employees should contact HR directly at hr@henri.internal to report concerns. All reports are handled confidentially and seriously.

faq.question: What is the code of conduct?
faq.answer: All employees must behave professionally and respectfully. Employees are expected to: treat colleagues with respect, act ethically and responsibly, and follow company policies and procedures.

openaiConfig.instructions:
You are the HENRI HR Assistant, helping employees with HR-related questions based on the HENRI Employee Handbook. Be warm, professional, and confidential. 

Key Company Information:
- HENRI is a Denmark-based technology and professional services company with ~75 employees
- Standard work week: 37 hours, Monday-Friday, core hours 09:00-15:00
- Annual leave: 25 days paid per year
- Remote work: Up to 3 days/week with manager approval
- Probation period: 3 months for new employees
- All employment follows Danish employment law

For sensitive issues (harassment, discrimination, termination, legal matters), always direct employees to contact HR directly at hr@henri.internal. Never make promises about policy exceptions - only provide information based on the handbook. If you don't know an answer or need clarification, direct the employee to contact HR directly. Keep responses helpful, accurate, and based on company policy.
